title: ReproducibiliTea Leuven
text:
E-mail
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
      Bluesky
  
  
      OSF
  
  
      KU Leuven page
  
  
      ReproducibiliTea Global
  
  
     Subscribe for next sessions
  

  
  
 ReproducibiliTea Leuven is a grassroots, early career researcher-led initiative to foster the use of open science practices in all fields of research. The original ReproducibiliTea group was founded by Sophia Crüwell, Amy Orben, and Sam Parsons at the University of Oxford in 2018, and has now grown into a global initiative across 99 institutions and 24 countries.
The Leuven chapter of ReproducibiliTea began in 2020. Our primary activity is a journal club that takes place roughly 2x per semester, during which we discuss articles or other resources (e.g. podcasts, online tools) relating to open science practices. Each journal club session is led by a member of the ReproducibiliTea Leuven organising team and focuses on a different challenge or (potential) solution to addressing issues of transparency, reproducibility, and replicability.
Subscribe here to attend the next sessions: https://tinyurl.com/reprotealvn
